page.title: 11BERKSHIRE GOLF CLUB.
page.content:
Our class spent an afternoon at the {Berkshire Golf Club.} The Club is on the{Crown Estate.} This is land which belongs to the reigning monarch by right of the Crown. The money from the golf course, mainly membership fees, goes to the Crown Estate and any profit that the Crown Estate gets goes to the Government. In return the monarch and his family get an allowance called the Civil List.
The idea for a{Golf Club}was put forward in 1926. The purpose of it was to encourage people to build houses and to live nearby,but several events have prevented this happening. First, in 1931, the club suffered a financial crisis, then the War came and after it the{Planning Acts} designated it as{Green Belt}land where no more building may take place.
